Hey you

I'm a freelance designer based in Yorkshire.

I help multidisciplinary teams deliver services in a user centred way by designing accessible experiences.

As a interaction designer contractor, I mainly serve clients in the public sector. I take pride in my ability to work closely and seamlessly integrate into their teams. Through this approach, I've been able to deliver exceptional services and lead projects that meet user and business needs.

Learn about me and my previous projects

Discovery within DWP’s first design system

Working on the design system team, spending much of that time ensuring it was a community led service whilst being valuable.

Helping the Government lowering fraud online

Working with the Government, building a service to allow users to report someone committing benefit fraud.

Rebranding Sky Sports Fantasy Football app

I helped to create a leading digital mobile experience that was aimed at current and new users to Fantasy Football.

I have worked in various industries on several high-profile projects, including NHS, Department of Work and Pensions (DWP), HMRC, Sky Bet, British Airways, Royal Mail, DEFRA, Sky Sports, Man City, and Jet2.

Read about my work

Want to work with me?

I have often worked in UK government departments and NHS within Scrum teams. I usually am known as an interaction designer, building my designs as working prototypes (in HTML/CSS/JavaScript) for usability testing.

I would love to discuss anything with you, no matter what it is, concept, blog post, podcast, mentoring, dinner choices; give me a holler!

Writings, weeknotes and thoughts

I often share weeknotes and other pieces, and if you wish to see my full list go here, but here are my most favourite and popular articles to get you started:

Cheering the designer

This past year was the year I started teaching, it was the year I learned more about myself than ever before and it was a time I learned more about others and their situations, their cultures, and their problems.

What to look for in a mentor

I’ve seen and read a lot recently about needing a mentor, the value of being a mentee and who you should use and look up to and I just wanted to share the framework I lean toward every time I’ve mentored with the hope it might help you pick the best mentor for you, and get the most out of the experience.
